document.description: ISDA 2018 Credit Support Annex for Initial Margin (IM) (Security Interest – New York Law)

disclaimer.body:
ISDA does not assume any responsibility for any use to which this document may be put. Each party must satisfy itself as to the effectiveness and appropriateness of this document and ensure it is used and/or adapted to reflect the commercial intentions and legal and regulatory obligations of the parties.  Parties should seek legal, tax and accounting advice and consult with any other adviser they deem appropriate prior to using this document.

ISDA has not undertaken to review any applicable laws and regulations of any jurisdiction in which this document may be used or of any jurisdiction whose laws or regulations affect derivative contracts, indices, securities and/or currencies that may be the subject of a privately negotiated derivative transaction.  Parties are therefore advised to consider the application of any relevant jurisdiction’s legal, regulatory, tax, accounting, exchange or other requirements that may exist in connection with using this document.

documentPack.name: ISDA Initial Margin Documents
documentPack.description: This pack contains documents to be negotiated in connection with Initial Margin regulations. Included in the pack are ISDA-published documents, as well as Clearstream and Euroclear co-published documents.
documentPack.disclaimer: Parties are responsible for determining the appropriateness of the choice of document and should seek legal, tax and accounting advice and consult with any other adviser they deem appropriate prior to using any document on CreateiQ.

documentPublisher.name: ISDA
documentPublisher.description: The International Swaps and Derivatives Association is the leading trade association for participants in the over-the-counter derivatives market.

pledgor_rights_event.textAmendment:
“Pledgor Rights Event” means an Early Termination Date in respect of all Transactions has occurred or been designated as the result of an Event of Default or Access Condition with respect to the Secured Party; provided that:

  1. if “Pledgor Full Discharge Condition” is specified as applicable here, a Pledgor Rights Event will not occur unless the Pledgor (A) has provided a statement to the Secured Party in respect of such Early Termination Date pursuant to Section 6(d) of this Agreement and (B) is claiming that an amount under Section 6(e) of this Agreement (I) is payable to the Pledgor, (II) is zero or (III) is payable by the Pledgor but (x) has been discharged in full together with any accrued interest or (y) will be discharged in full together with any accrued interest in whole or in part pursuant to the Pledgor’s exercise of the Delivery in Lieu Right as notified in writing by the Pledgor to the Secured Party in connection with its delivery of a Pledgor Access Notice, if applicable: Pledgor Full Discharge Condition is [Applicable][Not Applicable];

    and

  2. if “Cooling-off Period Condition” is specified as applicable here, a Pledgor Rights Event will not occur unless two Local Business Days have passed following the provision of a statement to the Secured Party pursuant to Section 6(d) of this Agreement: Cooling-off Period Condition is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

    Notwithstanding the foregoing, if “Control Agreement Pledgor Rights Event” is specified as applicable here with respect to a party as the Pledgor, a “Pledgor Rights Event” will only occur upon the occurrence of one or more of the events that the Pledgor and the Secured Party have agreed, in the Control Agreement or otherwise, will permit the Pledgor to exercise sole and exclusive control of the Posted Collateral (IM) held under the Control Agreement:

    With respect to Party A acting in its capacity as the Pledgor and Party B acting in its capacity as the Secured Party: Control Agreement Pledgor Rights Event is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

    With respect to Party B acting in its capacity as the Pledgor and Party A acting in its capacity as the Secured Party: Control Agreement Pledgor Rights Event is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

Specifying updated text

Adding more text

Amending text

delivery_in_lieu_right.textAmendment:
Delivery in Lieu Right. If specified as applicable here, the below (the “Delivery in Lieu Right”) will be inserted at the end of Paragraph 8(b): Delivery in Lieu Right is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

“The Pledgor may, without the consent of the Secured Party, direct the Custodian (IM) to transfer to the Secured Party so much of the Posted Collateral (IM) as is the Cash equivalent, by reference to the fair market value at or about the time of such transfer as determined by the Pledgor, necessary to satisfy (together with any other payments already made by the Pledgor) all amounts payable by the Pledgor pursuant to Section 6(e) (together with any accrued interest). Such Section 6(e) payment obligation (together with any obligation to pay interest) of the Pledgor will be deemed satisfied to the extent of such transfer. At the time of giving directions to the Custodian (IM) for such transfer, the Pledgor shall also send a notice to the Secured Party specifying the details of the Posted Collateral (IM) being transferred and the related Cash equivalent as determined by the Pledgor. For the avoidance of doubt, the Pledgor in all events will remain liable for any amounts remaining unpaid after such transfer, and to the extent of any transfer of Posted Collateral (IM) under this subsection, the Pledgor waives any right to redemption or to require the Secured Party to make disposition of, account for any surplus in respect of, or request the sale of such Posted Collateral (IM) by the Secured Party.”

Specifying updated text

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be 3% of its Net Asset Value.
Additional definitions: “Net Asset Value” means the assets of Party B less the liabilities of Party B (as determined by reference to the most recent accounts).
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be 5% of its Net Asset Value.
Additional definitions: “Net Asset Value” means the gross assets of Party B less the liabilities of Party B (as determined by reference to the most recent accounts).
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Not Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be GBP 5,000,000.
Additional definitions: Not Applicable
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Not Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will not apply to Party B.
Additional definitions: Not Applicable
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be 3% of its Net Asset Value.
Additional definitions: “Net Asset Value” means the assets of Party B less the liabilities of Party B (as determined by reference to the most recent accounts).
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Not Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be 3% of its Net Asset Value.
Additional definitions: “Net Asset Value” means the assets of Party B less the liabilities of Party B (as determined by reference to the most recent accounts).
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be 5% of its Net Asset Value.
Additional definitions: “Net Asset Value” means the gross assets of Party B less the liabilities of Party B (as determined by reference to the most recent accounts).
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Not Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be GBP 5,000,000.
Additional definitions: Not Applicable
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Not Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will not apply to Party B.
Additional definitions: Not Applicable
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be 3% of its Net Asset Value.
Additional definitions: “Net Asset Value” means the assets of Party B less the liabilities of Party B (as determined by reference to the most recent accounts).
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Not Applicable to Party B

fallback_to_mandatory_method.textAmendment:
“Fallback to Mandatory Method” means, if specified as applicable in the Regime Table with respect to a Regime, ISDA SIMM™ will be the Method applicable to such Regime, but if, to the extent that a party notifies the other that it is mandatory under such Regime for such notifying party to apply the Mandatory Method to one or more transaction types with respect to either the Pledgor’s or the Secured Party’s posting or collecting obligation, as applicable (specifying in such notice the relevant transaction types), then with effect from the later of (x) the date which is the [●] calendar day after such notice is effectively delivered and (y) the date specified in such notice as the date on which the Mandatory Method becomes mandatory under such Regime (and only in respect of Transactions of the relevant transaction type entered into after the later of the dates in (x) and (y)):

  1. SIMM Exception will be applicable solely with respect to such transaction types; and

  2. the applicable Method for such transaction types will be the Mandatory Method.

pledgor_rights_event.textAmendment:
“Pledgor Rights Event” means an Early Termination Date in respect of all Transactions has occurred or been designated as the result of an Event of Default or Access Condition with respect to the Secured Party; provided that:

  1. if “Pledgor Full Discharge Condition” is specified as applicable here, a Pledgor Rights Event will not occur unless the Pledgor (A) has provided a statement to the Secured Party in respect of such Early Termination Date pursuant to Section 6(d) of this Agreement and (B) is claiming that an amount under Section 6(e) of this Agreement (I) is payable to the Pledgor, (II) is zero or (III) is payable by the Pledgor but (x) has been discharged in full together with any accrued interest or (y) will be discharged in full together with any accrued interest in whole or in part pursuant to the Pledgor’s exercise of the Delivery in Lieu Right as notified in writing by the Pledgor to the Secured Party in connection with its delivery of a Pledgor Access Notice, if applicable: Pledgor Full Discharge Condition is [Applicable][Not Applicable];

    and

  2. if “Cooling-off Period Condition” is specified as applicable here, a Pledgor Rights Event will not occur unless two Local Business Days have passed following the provision of a statement to the Secured Party pursuant to Section 6(d) of this Agreement: Cooling-off Period Condition is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

    Notwithstanding the foregoing, if “Control Agreement Pledgor Rights Event” is specified as applicable here with respect to a party as the Pledgor, a “Pledgor Rights Event” will only occur upon the occurrence of one or more of the events that the Pledgor and the Secured Party have agreed, in the Control Agreement or otherwise, will permit the Pledgor to exercise sole and exclusive control of the Posted Collateral (IM) held under the Control Agreement:

    With respect to Party A acting in its capacity as the Pledgor and Party B acting in its capacity as the Secured Party: Control Agreement Pledgor Rights Event is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

    With respect to Party B acting in its capacity as the Pledgor and Party A acting in its capacity as the Secured Party: Control Agreement Pledgor Rights Event is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

Specifying updated text

Adding more text

Amending text

delivery_in_lieu_right.textAmendment:
Delivery in Lieu Right. If specified as applicable here, the below (the “Delivery in Lieu Right”) will be inserted at the end of Paragraph 8(b): Delivery in Lieu Right is [Applicable][Not Applicable].

“The Pledgor may, without the consent of the Secured Party, direct the Custodian (IM) to transfer to the Secured Party so much of the Posted Collateral (IM) as is the Cash equivalent, by reference to the fair market value at or about the time of such transfer as determined by the Pledgor, necessary to satisfy (together with any other payments already made by the Pledgor) all amounts payable by the Pledgor pursuant to Section 6(e) (together with any accrued interest). Such Section 6(e) payment obligation (together with any obligation to pay interest) of the Pledgor will be deemed satisfied to the extent of such transfer. At the time of giving directions to the Custodian (IM) for such transfer, the Pledgor shall also send a notice to the Secured Party specifying the details of the Posted Collateral (IM) being transferred and the related Cash equivalent as determined by the Pledgor. For the avoidance of doubt, the Pledgor in all events will remain liable for any amounts remaining unpaid after such transfer, and to the extent of any transfer of Posted Collateral (IM) under this subsection, the Pledgor waives any right to redemption or to require the Secured Party to make disposition of, account for any surplus in respect of, or request the sale of such Posted Collateral (IM) by the Secured Party.”

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be GBP 5,000,000.
Additional definitions: Not Applicable
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Not Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will not apply to Party B.
Additional definitions: Not Applicable
Credit Event upon merger: Credit Event upon Merger Applicable to Party B

Cross Default: Cross Default will apply to Party B and for the purposes of which the Threshold Amount will be 3% of its Net Asset Value.
Additional definitions: “Net Asset Value” means the assets of Party B less the liabilities of Party B (as determined by reference to the most recent accounts).

fallback_to_mandatory_method.textAmendment:
“Fallback to Mandatory Method” means, if specified as applicable in the Regime Table with respect to a Regime, ISDA SIMM™ will be the Method applicable to such Regime, but if, to the extent that a party notifies the other that it is mandatory under such Regime for such notifying party to apply the Mandatory Method to one or more transaction types with respect to either the Pledgor’s or the Secured Party’s posting or collecting obligation, as applicable (specifying in such notice the relevant transaction types), then with effect from the later of (x) the date which is the [●] calendar day after such notice is effectively delivered and (y) the date specified in such notice as the date on which the Mandatory Method becomes mandatory under such Regime (and only in respect of Transactions of the relevant transaction type entered into after the later of the dates in (x) and (y)):

  1. SIMM Exception will be applicable solely with respect to such transaction types; and

  2. the applicable Method for such transaction types will be the Mandatory Method.
